User Interface (UI) and User Experience (UX) Design: As digital products proliferate, UI/UX design skills enable graphic designers to envision intuitive interfaces that prioritize user engagement and streamline workflows. This course covers interface architecture best practices (e.g., navigation patterns, content prioritization), accessibility considerations (e.g., contrast ratios, keyboard navigation), wireframing methodologies (e.g., Sketch, Figma), prototyping tools (e.g., InVision Studio), user research techniques (e.g., user testing), and information architecture principles (e.g., card sorting).

6. Motion Graphics and Animation Fundamentals: Animating dynamic visuals for promotional videos, infographics, social media campaigns or explainer videos requires specialized technical know-how in software such as Adobe After Effects or Cinema 4D. This course covers key animation concepts (e.g., keyframing vs. Motion Graphics templates), compositing techniques (e.g., layer organization), keyframe timing (e.g., easing curves), 2D/3D object manipulation (e.g., shape tweening), audio synchronization methods (e.g., sound effects integration), and export settings for optimized output across multiple platforms.

7. Advanced Typography Techniques for Visual Communication: Typography is a vital component of graphic design; this course emphasizes typographic hierarchy refinement, readability optimization techniques (e.g., x-height variations), typeface selection strategies based on contextual factors (e.g., cultural associations), layout experimentation approaches (e.g., grid systems vs. Modular scaling), custom typeface creation with font editors like Font Selfie or Glyphs App, and accessibility considerations for inclusive typographic practices (e.g., font size flexibility).

By immersing yourself in these comprehensive courses that cater to diverse design applications within graphic design domains, you will enhance your knowledge base, develop practical skills using relevant tools, and cultivate a well-rounded perspective to tackle real-world design challenges with creativity and effectiveness.

instruction:
Create a daily itinerary based on the given information.

Our family is looking for a 9-day Morocco trip that has light to moderate activity levels.
output:
Day 1: Arrival in Marrakech

Upon arrival at Marrakech Menara International Airport, your family will be greeted by a private driver and transferred to your chosen accommodation in the heart of the Medina (old town). After settling in, take some time to explore the vibrant souks (markets) on foot, soaking in the colors, smells, and sounds of this bustling cultural hub.

Day 2: Marrakech City Tour

Start your Moroccan adventure with a comprehensive sightseeing tour of Marrakech. Your guide will lead you through iconic landmarks such as Bahia Palace, Saadian Tombs, and Koutoubia Mosque (from outside), revealing the city's rich history and architectural gems. Afterward, unwind at a traditional hammam (bathhouse) for a relaxing steam, scrub, and massage experience.

Day 3: Atlas Mountain Drive & Berber Village Visit

Escape the city heat with a scenic drive into the Atlas Mountains range. Admire panoramic vistas en route to a Berber village where you'll learn about local customs and daily life from hospitable hosts over mint tea. Depending on your preference, opt for a leisurely stroll or easy hike within lush surroundings before returning to Marrakech for dinner at a renowned restaurant showcasing Moroccan cuisine.

Day 4: Ouarzazate & Kasbahs Exploration

Embark on an early departure to Ouarzazate, dubbed the "Gateway to the Sahara," passing through enchanting landscapes dotted with Kasbahs (fortified earthen buildings). Along the way, pause at UNESCO-listed Ait Benhaddou Kasbah for a guided tour of its maze-like alleyways and rooftop vistas. Continue to Ouarzazate and check into your accommodations amidst captivating desert scenery before enjoying sunset views over a Moroccan feast at a local eatery.

Day 5: Road to Skoura & Rose Valley

Begin your day with a leisurely drive through verdant Skoura Oasis, renowned for its palm groves and Kasbahs like El Amarnaye and Taliouine (both accessible via short walks). Take in scenic vistas en route to picturesque Kalaa Mgouna ("Rose City") amidst rose plantations blooming in season (spring). Sample local rose products and browse handicrafts before settling into your next overnight stay in Boumalne Dades.

Day 6: Dades Gorge & Monkey Valley

Embark on a scenic drive along the Dades Valley, pausing at Dades Gorge's breathtaking amphitheater of towering red cliffs carved by the Dades River. Next, encounter playful Barbary macaques in their natural habitat during a short hike in Monkey Valley (Valley of Apes), where these primates freely roam amidst rugged scenery. Return to Boumalne Dades for dinner and relaxation in tranquil surroundings.

Day 7: Todra Gorge & Tinmal Mosque Discovery

Experience another breathtaking natural wonder as you venture to Todra Gorge, where towering rock walls form a dramatic canyon passable by foot via numerous trails of varying difficulty levels (select one suitable for your family's comfort level). Afterward, ascend winding roads leading to Tinmal Mosque, a stunning 13th-century architectural marvel set amidst mountainous splendor. Overnight in nearby Midelt.

Day 8: Midelt & Cedar Forest Adventure

Start your day with a visit to Midelt's bustling souk before venturing into the Atlas Mountains' cedar forests for a leisurely nature walk or gentle horseback ride amidst ancient trees and mountain vistas (depending on preference). Indulge in a traditional Moroccan lunch featuring local specialties before continuing to Fez for an evening stroll through its Medina's labyrinthine alleys teeming with artisanal workshops and culinary delights.

Day 9: Fez Medina & Departure

On your final day in Morocco, immerse yourself in Fez Medina's vibrant tapestry of historic sites, arts & crafts markets, and gastronomic delights. Highlights include Al Attarine Madrasa (Islamic college), Dar Batha Museum (traditional arts museum), and Chouara Tanneries (leatherworking hub). Afterward, enjoy a leisurely farewell lunch at a renowned restaurant before transferring to Fez-Saïss International Airport for your departure flight home.

instruction: Give students tips on how to keep their nerves under control during class presentations.
output:
1. Prepare thoroughly: One of the most effective ways to manage nerves during a class presentation is to prepare thoroughly. The more familiar you are with the material, the less anxious you will feel. Practice your presentation multiple times in front of a mirror, friends, or family members to gain confidence and overcome any unexpected obstacles.

2. Visualize success: Before your presentation, take a few minutes to visualize yourself delivering your talk confidently and successfully. Imagine yourself engaging with your audience, answering questions gracefully, and receiving positive feedback. Visualization can help shift your mindset from nervousness to optimism.

3. Focus on breathing techniques: Nervousness can trigger shallow breathing patterns that exacerbate anxiety symptoms. Before starting your presentation, take deep breaths to calm your nervous system and activate your parasympathetic nervous system, promoting relaxation. Inhale deeply through your nose for four counts, hold for seven counts, and exhale slowly through your mouth for eight counts to regulate your breathing rhythm.

4. Practice positive self-talk: Negative self-talk can amplify anxiety levels during presentations. Replace self-critical thoughts with positive affirmations that boost self-esteem, such as "I am well-prepared and capable of delivering an insightful presentation," "I have practiced extensively and am confident in my abilities," or "I am eager to share my knowledge with engaged peers."

5. Establish eye contact with your audience: Maintaining eye contact with your listeners during your presentation can foster a connection and diminish feelings of isolation. Rather than fixating on notes or internalizing worries, shift your gaze frequently towards different individuals in the audience to engage them meaningfully.

6. Utilize body language effectively: Posture conveys vital nonverbal cues that influence how you come across to your audience. Stand upright, with shoulders relaxed and head level, radiating confident energy. Gestures such as hand movements, facial expressions, and purposeful pacing can express enthusiasm and emphasize key points without distracting from your message's content.

7. Take breaks if necessary: If you feel overwhelmed during the presentation, pause briefly and take a deep breath to regain composure. Acknowledge any mistakes or missteps calmly, reassuring listeners that you remain focused on sharing valuable insights rather than striving for perfection.

8. Seek support from others: Lean on supportive peers or mentors to bolster confidence levels before a presentation. Share specific concerns about the upcoming talk and ask for constructive feedback after practicing together or receive encouraging words from trusted figures who have navigated similar experiences successfully.

instruction: You can easily make your holidays more eco-friendly by following these simple steps:
output:
1. Choose eco-friendly gift options: Consider buying environmentally friendly gifts such as reusable water bottles, cloth shopping bags, plant-based skincare products, or homemade treats packaged in recyclable or biodegradable materials.

2. Reduce packaging waste: When shopping for gifts, opt for products with minimal packaging, choose reusable gift wrap alternatives like fabric bags, newspaper, or reusable gift boxes made from recycled materials.

3. Send e-cards or paperless invitations: Send digital holiday cards instead of printed ones or use online platforms to create and share digital invitations to reduce paper waste.

4. Plan eco-conscious decorations: Decorate with natural elements like dried flowers, pine cones, and evergreen boughs, use LED lights instead of incandescent bulbs, and consider renting holiday decorations rather than purchasing new ones each year.

5. Reduce food waste: Plan meals ahead of time and avoid overbuying perishable items. Donate leftovers to local food banks or shelters or compost food scraps instead of tossing them in the trash.

6. Choose sustainable transportation options: Encourage carpooling, public transit usage, biking, or walking when traveling to holiday events to reduce carbon emissions from personal vehicles.

7. Use energy-efficient appliances and lighting: Power down electronics when not in use during holiday gatherings and switch to energy-efficient LED bulbs for festive lighting displays to minimize electricity consumption.

8. Opt for eco-friendly cleaning products: Switch to non-toxic and biodegradable cleaning solutions when tidying up after holiday preparations to minimize indoor pollution and water pollution from harsh chemicals.

9. Support local and organic food sources: Shop at farmers markets for seasonal produce and locally sourced products to reduce transportation emissions associated with imported goods while supporting local economies.

10. Practice conscious consumption habits: Consider setting limits on material gift exchanges and prioritize experiences, such as tickets to cultural events, outdoor adventures, or quality time together without excessive consumption.

instruction:
Think of an idea to help you win a challenge given to you. Write the steps you need to take to develop the idea as well.

What can you make by recycling and repurposing some old, previously used materials? We want to see it!
Projects must incorporate some kind of used materials - take that old used thing, and turn it into something new and different!
E-waste is a huge problem. What can you make using old electronics and other salvageable electronic materials? 
We have a special judges prize for our favorite Instructable that incorporates or is related to reusing e-waste.
Be smart and be safe; note that potentially deadly projects (like Lichtenberg/fractal wood burning machines) will not be allowed to be published or submitted to this contest.
output:
Upcycled E-Waste Turned Stunning Geometric Wall Art

Electronic waste (e-waste) poses a significant environmental challenge globally, making it crucial to explore innovative ways of repurposing these obsolete devices into functional and aesthetically pleasing home decor pieces. One creative solution to address this issue is transforming old electronic components and circuit boards into mesmerizing geometric wall art.

Here are the steps to develop an eco-friendly, visually striking e-waste upcycling project:

1. Gather Materials:

- A mix of salvaged electronic components such as circuit boards, capacitors, resistors, and IC chips
- A selection of colorful wires (e.g., copper, aluminum, or brass)
- A wooden canvas board (at least 16x20 inches)
- Screwdriver, pliers, wire cutters, and wire strippers
- Glue gun and glue sticks
- Optional: paint or varnish for added durability and finishing touch

2. Design a Geometric Pattern:

Brainstorm a visually appealing geometric pattern that complements your home decor style and utilizes the diverse sizes and shapes of your e-waste materials. Sketch a rough draft, then translate it onto paper using a ruler and pencil to scale accurately.

3. Sort and Clean Electronic Components:

Disassemble the electronic devices into individual components by removing screws and prying open cases with pliers. Carefully extract circuit boards and separate capacitors, resistors, IC chips, and other small electronic parts from their original circuitry. Thoroughly clean each piece using a soft brush or compressed air to eliminate dust residue.

4. Prepare Wooden Canvas Board:

Sand the wooden canvas board surface smooth with fine-grit sandpaper to remove any rough edges or splinters. Wipe it clean with a damp cloth before applying a base coat of paint or clear varnish (optional). Let it dry completely before proceeding.

5. Create Geometric Shapes with E-Waste Components:

Using your pattern as a guide, select suitable e-waste components based on their shape, size, and color contrasts to construct geometric shapes like triangles, squares, hexagons, or other intricate patterns. For instance:

- Circuit board fragments can serve as rectangular tiles or irregular shapes to fill in larger geometric outlines.
- Resistors' cylindrical shape and color variation make ideal circular accents within squares or hexagons.
- IC chips with their compact footprint can serve as mini dots or accentuate angles between intersecting lines.
- Capacitors with their capacious cylindrical form can represent curved or bulbous shapes within designs.

6. Wire Connections and Attachment to Board:

To secure these electronic components onto the wooden canvas board, follow these steps:

- Cut colored wire segments (preferably copper, aluminum, or brass) into varying lengths to connect e-waste components visually and mechanically within your chosen geometric arrangement. For instance, longer wires might span across two separate units while shorter wires link adjacent components within clusters.
- Using pliers, bend wire ends into hooks that fit snugly over the back of each component's exposed metal legs or protruding contacts for added stability during assembly.
- Starting from one corner of your pattern, thread each wire segment through its corresponding drilled hole on the wooden canvas board (preferably created with a drill bit slightly smaller than the wire diameter). Repeat for all intended connection points until all pieces remain suspended in midair via the wire network. 

7. Secure with Hot Glue Gun:

To prevent any potential dislodgment or movement within the geometric arrangement, apply a thin bead of hot glue along each wire segment's underside where it intersects with the wooden canvas board surface. Be mindful not to overuse glue or obstruct visual coherence among interconnected shapes. 

8. Final Touches (Optional):

If desired, add additional finishing touches such as clear coat varnish to safeguard against dust accumulation and enhance durability over time. Alternatively, experiment with experimentally blending in complementary paint colors or patterns around the artwork's edges for an extra pop of aesthetic flair. 

By following these steps, you can transform salvaged e-waste into visually stunning geometric wall art that repurposes materials otherwise destined for electronic landfills while showcasing inventive ingenuity in sustainable design practice!

instruction:
There are many creative projects we can build at home that are related to the given theme, so let's list some of them.

Theme: Circuits
output:
1. DIY LED Flashing Light Circuit: Using simple electronic components such as resistors, LED bulbs, and a 555 timer IC chip, create a circuit that flashes an LED light on and off at regular intervals. This project allows for experimentation with adjusting the flash rate and exploring how resistor values affect LED brightness.

2. Solar-Powered Battery Charger Circuit: Build a solar-powered charging system using solar panels, a charge controller, a battery, and a DC-DC converter module. This circuit enables charging rechargeable batteries with energy harvested directly from sunlight, promoting sustainable energy practices.

3. Electronic Musical Instrument Circuit Kit: Construct a basic electronic musical instrument using an Arduino microcontroller board, piezoelectric transducers, and capacitors. Program the Arduino board to recognize and translate sound vibrations into electronic signals, creating unique and interactive musical compositions.

4. Smart Home Automation Switch Circuit: Create a customized smart home automation switch utilizing a low-cost microcontroller board like NodeMCU or ESP8266. With built-in Wi-Fi capabilities, this circuit enables remote control of connected devices (such as lights, appliances, thermostats) via a smartphone app or voice commands through virtual assistants like Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant.

5. DIY Digital Clock Circuit Kit: Build a functional digital clock utilizing an ATmega328 microcontroller board, a real-time clock (DS1307), and basic components such as resistors, capacitors, and LED displays. With a user-friendly interface showcasing hours, minutes, and seconds, this circuit showcases practical applications of embedded systems design.

6. Blinking Morse Code Circuit: Create an audible Morse code signal generator using a 555 timer IC chip, an audio amplifier module, and resistors. This project encourages experimentation with Morse code encoding and decoding principles while producing engaging audio outputs.

7. Remote-Controlled Robotic Arm Circuit Kit: Build a motorized robotic arm system using an Arduino microcontroller board and stepper motors powered by shields like Adafruit Motor Shield or Pololu Dual Motor Driver Carrier Board. By integrating sensors such as ultrasonic rangefinders or IR proximity detectors, this circuit demonstrates versatile motion control applications in robotics engineering.

8. LED Rainbow Fading Circuit: Construct a color-changing LED strip display utilizing an addressable RGB LED module (e.g., WS2812B) driven by an Arduino Nano microcontroller board or similar ATmega328-based platform. With the aid of the FastLED library, create dynamic lighting effects simulating rainbows or other visually striking fading patterns.

9. Low-Cost RFID Access Control System Circuit: Design an RFID access control system leveraging an RFID reader module (e.g., MFRC522) connected to an ATmega328 microcontroller board and relay module for door lock activation/deactivation. This circuit exemplifies secure keyless entry implementation via RFID tag identification technology.

10. DIY Solar-Powered Water Pump Controller Circuit: Combine solar energy harvesting with water pumping capabilities by constructing a solar-powered water pump controller circuit utilizing a solar charge controller module (e.g., MPPT or PWM type), an Arduino Nano microcontroller board, and relay module driving the water pump's transistor output stage. This project showcases integrating renewable energy sources with agricultural irrigation or small-scale aquatic ecosystem needs.

instruction:
Make a list of the materials that will be required to build the given tool.

Coffee Darkness Meter
output:
To build a Coffee Darkness Meter, also known as a Refractometer for Coffee, you will need the following materials:

1. Refractometer: A refractometer specifically designed for measuring coffee soluble solids (SS) is essential for this project. Look for one with a digital display and a measurement range suitable for coffee analysis, typically ranging from 1.200 to 1.350 refractive index units (RIU).

2. Calibration Standard Solution: To ensure accurate measurements, you will need a calibration standard solution with a known concentration of coffee soluble solids. This standard solution can be purchased from specialty coffee equipment suppliers or made using a recipe that involves mixing specific amounts of dry coffee grounds with distilled water to create a concentrated solution.

3. Distilled Water: High-purity distilled water is necessary for both calibration standards preparation and reference samples measurement to avoid affecting the reading with impurities or minerals present in tap water.

4. Coffee Samples: You will need freshly brewed coffee samples prepared using your preferred brewing method, such as espresso, pour-over, French press, or drip coffee makers, to measure their corresponding soluble solids content levels.

5. Cleaning Solutions: To prevent cross-contamination and maintain accurate measurements, clean your refractometer regularly with isopropyl alcohol (IPA) or another suitable cleaning solution recommended by the manufacturer.

6. Microfiber Cloths or Lint-free Paper Towels: To avoid fingerprint smudges and scratches on the refractometer prism surface, keep clean microfiber cloths or lint-free paper towels handy during calibration and testing procedures.

7. Measuring Cylinder (Optional): A small measuring cylinder, ideally made of glass with graduated markings, can aid in accurately pipetting precise volumes of coffee and calibration solutions onto the refractometer prism consistently.

8. Temperature Control Equipment (Optional): To ensure consistent readings, you may consider temperature control equipment such as a water bath or temperature-controlled environment to maintain stable ambient temperatures during measurement cycles.

9. Record Keeping Materials: To track your measurements over time, document your findings using pen and paper or a spreadsheet software that allows you to log date, sample preparation method, coffee bean type or origin, SS measurement results, and other relevant details to analyze trends and compare brewing techniques' efficacy in producing desired coffee densities.

instruction:
Provide a detailed explanation of the steps that are required in order to construct the given project.

Steam Engine Using an Empty Beer Can
output:
To construct a steam engine utilizing an empty beer can, follow these steps:

Materials needed:

- One empty beer can
- Small metal screws (2-3 inches in length)
- Small eye bolts (2-3 inches in length)
- Nuts and washers
- Copper wire (thin, approximately 22 gauge)
- Small round rubber stoppers (optional, for mounting the engine)
- Soldering iron and solder
- Pliers (round nose, flat nose, wire cutters)
- Sandpaper
- Water pump tubing (optional, for adding water circulation)

Instructions:

1. Begin by carefully cleaning the empty beer can thoroughly with soap and water to remove any residual labels or debris. Allow it to dry completely before proceeding.

2. Using pliers, bend the copper wire into a U-shape at one end, approximately 1 inch from its straight length. This U-shape will serve as the engine's piston rod.

3. Next, drill two small holes near the top of the beer can, approximately 1 inch apart from each other and aligned horizontally. These holes will accommodate the screws that will connect the engine's cylinder block to the base plate later on.

4. Measure and mark a vertical centerline on the beer can using a pencil or marker. This line will serve as a reference for attaching components and balancing the engine's parts.

5. Bend another length of copper wire into a circular shape approximately 1 inch in diameter to create the cylinder block. Use pliers to shape the wire into a snug fit inside the beer can's body, aligning its center with the vertical centerline marking. Secure this cylinder block in place with two small eye bolts protruding outwards through pre-drilled holes on either side of the beer can body, making sure they sit flush with its surface.

6. Thread nuts onto each eye bolt protruding from the beer can, leaving a small gap between each nut and eye bolt head. Then, screw in corresponding washers and eye bolt heads onto these nuts, ensuring they remain level with each other and snugly tightened to secure the cylinder block firmly within the beer can body.

7. Create a steam chest plate by bending another length of copper wire into a circular shape approximately 2 inches in diameter, centered along the vertical centerline marking. This plate will sit atop the cylinder block and hold steam pressure within the engine's cylinder. Use pliers to twist both ends of this wire into hooks that can grasp two screws inserted through drilled holes on either side of the beer can base, positioning them flush with its surface and parallel with each other. Tighten nuts and washers onto these screws to secure the steam chest plate in place above the cylinder block.

8. To connect the engine's piston rod to its cylinder block, thread one end of the U-shaped copper wire through the steam chest plate's hooked ends and bend it perpendicularly across the plate's centerline towards the opposite side of the beer can body. Use pliers to gently curve this wire segment downward slightly for clearance clearance from any potential obstructions within the engine assembly.

9. Form another U-shaped copper wire section approximately 1 inch long to serve as a connecting rod that links the piston rod to a mock flywheel assembly made from a small metal washer or circular disc (approximately 1 inch diameter). Thread this connecting rod through both hooks extending from either end of the piston rod's bent segment within the steam chest plate, keeping them level with one another. Attach nuts and washers onto corresponding screws inserted through drilled holes on opposite sides of the beer can base plate, securing this connecting rod assembly firmly within the engine structure while maintaining its balanced position relative to the piston rod's bent segment.

10. For added functionality, consider installing water circulation within your steam engine using flexible tubing connected between a small pump (such as a battery-powered water pump or manual bellows) and a drilled hole near one end of the beer can body. Thread one end of this tubing through an additional pre-drilled hole situated near the bottom of the steam chest plate and route it towards an opening atop the cylinder block, where it can enter and circulate water around internal engine components during operation for optimal heat transfer and efficiency (note that this step may require additional plumbing modifications depending on your chosen pump setup).

11. Finally, affix round rubber stoppers (if desired) onto any exposed threaded screw protrusions along the base plate's underside for enhanced stability when resting your finished steam engine model upon surfaces like desktops or display bases. With these steps completed, your functional miniature steam engine fashioned from an empty beer can should now be operational upon connection to an external heat source (e.g., hot water bath or propane torch) via its steam chest plate assembly, allowing for mechanical expansion and contraction of its piston rod/connecting rod/mock flywheel combination during cyclic power generation cycles.

instruction:
Estimate the cost of supplies required to create the given project and calculate the total cost.

DIY Water Chiller
Required items are: Ice-maker, Icebox/cooler, Temperature regulator, Aquarium pump x2, 12V power supply
output:
To estimate the cost of supplies required for a DIY water chiller using an ice-maker, icebox/cooler, temperature regulator, two aquarium pumps powered by a 12V power supply, you would need to consider the approximate costs of each item:

1. Ice-maker: The cost of an ice-maker can vary depending on the brand, size, and features. Generally, a basic ice-maker suitable for small aquariums may cost between $20 to $50.

2. Icebox/cooler: The cost of an icebox/cooler depends on its size, insulation quality, and additional features like built-in drainage or wheels. For a small aquarium setup, you can expect to spend between $20 to $100.

3. Temperature regulator: A reliable temperature controller suitable for aquarium applications usually costs between $20 to $50. Some models may include additional features such as wireless connectivity, multiple probe inputs, or advanced programming capabilities.

4. Aquarium pumps x2: You will need two aquarium pumps to circulate water through the chiller system. Aquarium pumps' price varies depending on their power output and flow rate capacity. For instance, a low-cost option could be a 100-gallon per hour (GPH) DC submersible pump priced between $10 to $25 each. Alternatively, if you require higher flow rates for larger aquariums, consider high-performance models ranging from $30 to $100+ per unit.

5. 12V Power Supply: Depending on the specific aquarium pump models chosen, a suitable 12V DC power adapter may cost around $5 to $20 apiece.

To calculate the total estimated cost of these DIY water chiller components, you can add up the item prices as follows:

- Ice-maker: $20 to $50
- Icebox/cooler: $20 to $100
- Temperature regulator: $20 to $50
- Aquarium pumps x2: ($10-$25 x 2) = $20 to $50 per pump for a total of $40 to $100
- 12V Power Supply x2: ($5-$20 x 2) = $10 to $40

Therefore, the estimated cost range for the necessary supplies needed for creating a DIY water chiller utilizing an ice-maker, icebox/cooler, temperature regulator, two aquarium pumps powered by a 12V power supply is approximately $80 to $290 USD, depending on your selection of equipment quality and features within this item category.

instruction:
Answer the following literature question as accurately as possible based on your knowledge of literature for high school students.

What does the green light symbolize at the end of the book?
output:
In F. Scott Fitzgerald's iconic novel, The Great Gatsby, the green light at the end of Daisy Buchanan's dock serves as a powerful symbol that represents both Gatsby's unfulfilled dreams and his fixation on the illusory notion of an idealized past with Daisy.

Throughout the novel, Gatsby's obsession with Daisy, who symbolizes his aspirations for wealth, status, and love, is central to his story arc. The green light across the bay from Gatsby's mansion serves as a potent visual cue that evokes Gatsby's romantic yearning for Daisy, whom he believes can fulfill his unrealistic desires for happiness and material success.

At the novel's climax, Gatsby attends Daisy's lavish party, hoping to catch a glimpse of her and potentially rekindle their relationship. As he gazes across the water towards Daisy's property, Gatsby fixates on the brilliant green light, which stands out against the darkness of nighttime Long Island Sound. The light represents Gatsby's unattainable aspiration to recapture his romantic connection with Daisy and recreate the idyllic past he idealizes.

For Gatsby, the green light embodies his dream of recapturing his lost love affair with Daisy, which he associates with prosperity and societal acceptance. Yet, this symbol also serves as a poignant reminder of Gatsby's tragic flaw – his relentless pursuit of a fleeting dream that ultimately leads to disillusionment, heartbreak, and eventual demise.

Thus, in The Great Gatsby, the green light at the end of Daisy Buchanan's dock symbolizes Gatsby's cherished yet elusive aspiration for a perfect past with Daisy amidst a world of illusion and superficiality. As such, this powerful image underscores the novel's recurring themes of romantic obsession, unfulfilled desire, and the ephemeral nature of human aspirations.

instruction: Develop a mental exercise that can help people manage their anxiety and explain how it works.
output:
One effective mental exercise for managing anxiety is called "progressive muscle relaxation (PMR)." PMR involves tensing and relaxing specific muscle groups throughout the body, with the goal of promoting physical relaxation and reducing muscle tension associated with anxiety symptoms.

Here are the steps to follow when practicing PMR for anxiety management:

1. Find a quiet, comfortable place where you won't be disturbed for 10-15 minutes. Sit or lie down in a comfortable position with your eyes closed.

2. Take deep breaths in through your nose and exhale slowly through your mouth, focusing on releasing any tension in your body with each exhale.

3. Starting at your feet, progressively tense and then release specific muscle groups in a systematic order:

- Toe muscles: Squeeze your toes together tightly for five seconds, then release the tension completely for another five seconds. Repeat this pattern several times, focusing solely on the sensations of tightening and releasing in your toes.

4. Move up to calf muscles: Contract your calf muscles by pulling your toes toward your shins as if you're trying to scrunch your toes under a blanket. Hold this tension for five seconds, then release fully for another five seconds.

5. Continue working your way upward through your thighs, buttocks, abdomen, chest, arms, hands, neck, and facial muscles. Tense each muscle group for five seconds before deliberately releasing tension for an equal amount of time.

6. Pay attention to how each muscle feels when relaxed, allowing yourself to become increasingly aware of the contrast between tension and release. This can help shift your focus away from anxious thoughts and encourage a sense of calmness within the body.

7. After completing each muscle group's sequence, pause briefly before transitioning to the next set to fully absorb the sensations of relaxation.

8. End by taking a few slow, deep breaths while allowing your entire body to sink deeper into relaxation mode.

By intentionally shifting focus away from anxious thoughts and toward physical sensations through PMR, individuals can promote relaxation and alleviate muscular tension commonly associated with anxiety symptoms. Over time, regular practice of PMR may help individuals become more attuned to their bodies' cues of tension and cultivate greater control over stress responses through mindful muscle manipulation techniques.

instruction: Give me an idea of the mental exercises you do to inspire yourself.
output:
One mental exercise that can help inspire oneself is visualization, also known as mental imagery or guided imagination. This technique involves creating a vivid mental image of a desired outcome, situation, or experience to stimulate motivation, focus, and positive emotions.

To practice visualization for inspiration, follow these steps:

1. Find a quiet, comfortable space where you can concentrate without interruption.

2. Choose a specific goal or intention you want to achieve or explore, such as enhancing creativity, boosting confidence, overcoming obstacles, or pursuing a personal dream.

3. Close your eyes and take deep breaths to relax your body and mind.

4. Use your imagination to visualize yourself already having accomplished your desired outcome or accomplishing the next step toward achieving it. Picture yourself in detail as if you are already there - what you see, hear, feel, smell, and even taste in this scenario.

5. Engage all your senses to immerse yourself in the imagined experience fully. For example, imagine the texture of the grass beneath your feet if you're envisioning a peaceful park setting, the warmth of sunshine on your skin if you're picturing a sunny day at the beach, or the sound of applause echoing after delivering a successful presentation at work.

6. Explore any emotions that arise as you immerse yourself in this imagined reality. Notice how it makes you feel when you succeed in this scenario - perhaps triumphant, joyful, confident, energized, or fulfilled.

7. Reflect on what inspired you about this mental image and how it relates to your goal or intention. What insights did you gain about your strengths, resources, values, priorities, or desired qualities? How can you cultivate more of these qualities within yourself to move closer toward your objective?

8. Consider repeating this visualization exercise regularly to reinforce the positive feelings and reinforce a clearer vision of the desired outcome's details. You can experiment with different settings or scenarios to keep the process engaging and adaptable to different aspirations.

By utilizing this visualization exercise regularly, one can tap into their imagination's power to inspire creativity and motivation while enhancing focus and emotional resilience amidst obstacles or uncertainties towards meaningful pursuits.

instruction:
Make a list of outdoor activities that are suitable for the given weather condition.

Temperature: 57 F, Showers
output:
1. Hiking: On a cool and overcast day with occasional showers, hiking can still be enjoyable. Choose well-drained trails with moderate inclines to keep warm while walking, and pack rain gear such as waterproof jackets, hats, and boots with good traction to handle wet surfaces. Consider exploring nearby state parks or nature preserves with scenic vistas or waterfalls, where you can appreciate the natural beauty amidst the changing weather.

2. Birdwatching: With mild temperatures and sporadic rainfall, birdwatching can be a delightful activity in this weather condition. Bring binoculars, a field guidebook, and a lightweight chair or blanket to sit comfortably amidst bird-rich habitats like wetlands, meadows, or forest edges. Observe migratory songbirds passing through or resident species seeking shelter from raindrops. Keep an eye out for common backyard species like American robins, cardinals, and blue jays, as well as waterfowl such as mallards, wood ducks, and great blue herons.

3. Kayaking or Canoeing: In moderately cool weather with occasional showers, calm waterways such as lakes, ponds, or rivers can offer a peaceful and invigorating experience in a kayak or canoe. Dress in layers with quick-drying clothing, waterproof footwear, and a life jacket to stay comfortable and protected against rain splashes. Choose sheltered bays or coves away from exposed areas prone to higher winds and wave action. Take advantage of the moody scenery as misty skies can enhance reflections and add drama to landscapes.

4. Fishing: With slightly lower temperatures and intermittent precipitation, fishing can be rewarding during this weather condition. Stock up on rain gear like breathable waders and splash jackets to stay dry while casting into nearby trout streams, ponds, or lakes teeming with freshwater species such as bass, bluegill, catfish, or panfish. Consider seeking out areas with cover like underwater vegetation, fallen trees, or rocky ledges for potential fish hiding spots during inclement weather.

5. Nature Photography: Amidst changing weather patterns of occasional showers and mild temperatures, capturing natural imagery can thrive in this atmospheric setting. Pack camera equipment including a tripod for steady shots and versatile lenses for capturing diverse perspectives of damp foliage, misty horizons, or textured water droplets on flora and fauna. Head to scenic overlooks or forested trails for dynamic compositions of misty mornings or rain-soaked wildflowers. Remember to exercise caution on wet surfaces while exploring outdoor photography opportunities.

instruction: Please provide us with a list of the best conservation starter questions related to the weather.
output:
1. How does climate change affect weather patterns, and what role can conservation efforts play in mitigating its impact?

2. How do shifts in precipitation patterns due to changing weather patterns impact ecosystems and the species they support? What conservation strategies can address these effects?

3. What measures can communities implement to adapt to increasingly extreme weather events, such as droughts, heatwaves, and floods, while simultaneously minimizing environmental damage caused by response efforts?

4. How does land use and land management affect regional weather patterns and consequent ecological outcomes? What conservation approaches can balance land use needs with weather-related sustainability goals?

5. Can promoting sustainable agricultural practices reduce greenhouse gas emissions contributing to weather fluctuations and enhance localized weather resilience for both farmers and wildlife populations?

6. How can restoring degraded ecosystems through reforestation, wetland preservation, and soil health initiatives influence regional climate dynamics, thereby promoting more stable weather conditions and ecological health?

7. What role do urban heat island effects play in weather-related conservation challenges, and how can innovative green infrastructure solutions help mitigate this impact while conserving energy resources?

8. In the context of weather variability, how might implementing renewable energy technologies contribute to reducing greenhouse gas emissions, thus potentially slowing atmospheric warming and associated weather extremes, while promoting ecological benefits?

9. How can conservationists engage with regional meteorological agencies to integrate climate forecasts into conservation planning and management practices for species-specific habitats and vulnerable ecosystems exposed to altered weather conditions?

10. In light of weather-driven disturbances such as wildfires, hurricanes, and storm surges, what conservation strategies promote proactive preparedness, ecological recovery, and community resilience amidst shifting climatic conditions?

instruction:
In relation to the given weather scenario, give some tips on how to adjust the travel plans with it.

a sudden temperature change
output:
If you are faced with a sudden temperature change during your travel plans, there are several adjustments you can consider to adapt accordingly:

1. Dress appropriately: Depending on the direction of the temperature change, you may need to switch out your wardrobe to accommodate the new climate conditions. If the temperature suddenly drops, pack warmer layers like thermal base layers, insulated jackets, scarves, and gloves. Conversely, if temperatures rise unexpectedly, pack lightweight, breathable clothing like cotton shirts, lightweight pants, and breathable shoes.

2. Modify your itinerary: Consider adjusting your travel schedule or itinerary to avoid exposure to extreme weather conditions that could be uncomfortable or even dangerous. For instance, if a sudden heatwave hits your destination, try to plan indoor activities like museums, galleries, or air-conditioned attractions during the hottest parts of the day. Alternatively, if cold snaps hit unexpectedly, look for indoor events, restaurants with cozy ambiance or consider rescheduling outdoor excursions for warmer times of day.

3. Stay hydrated: Regardless of the temperature shift, ensure you keep yourself hydrated by carrying plenty of water bottles or purchasing them regularly throughout your travels. Extreme heat or cold can lead to dehydration quickly, making it crucial to stay hydrated and maintain electrolyte levels.

4. Seek shelter or rescheduling accommodation: If the sudden temperature change becomes severe and poses a risk to your health or comfort level, consider seeking shelter or altering your accommodation arrangements. For example, if an unexpected cold snap occurs in an area without adequate heating infrastructure, consider relocating to a hotel with better insulation or heating systems to avoid freezing conditions.

5. Monitor weather updates and plan accordingly: Keep track of local weather forecasts via mobile apps or local news sources to stay informed about any sudden temperature changes that could affect your travel plans. This way, you can adjust accordingly by packing appropriate gear or changing travel dates if necessary to minimize discomfort or ensure safety during extreme weather events.

instruction:
Write a to-do list based on the given information.

Daily tasks in the pharmacy
output:
1. Prepare Medications: Start the day by reviewing the daily prescription orders, filling medications accurately and efficiently according to specific dosages, expiration dates, and any special handling instructions provided by healthcare providers.

2. Organize Inventory: Check inventory levels of commonly prescribed drugs, restock supplies as needed, and monitor expiration dates for medications approaching their end-of-life dates to ensure adequate stock for patient needs.

3. Maintain Record Keeping: Record all medication dispensing activity in the pharmacy system, including the medication name, quantity dispensed, prescription number, date filled, and any relevant notes (e.g., special instructions or insurance coverage status).

4. Monitor Prescription Refills: Regularly assess patient medication refill requests to guarantee timely refill availability and avoid stockouts. Review refill requests against existing inventory levels and anticipated demand to plan for necessary reordering in advance.

5. Conduct Medication Therapy Management (MTM): Engage with patients during medication therapy management (MTM) consultations to identify potential medication-related concerns, such as adverse drug reactions, medication interactions, dosage optimization, and addressing non-adherence barriers. Offer appropriate interventions, educational resources, and referrals to healthcare professionals as needed.

6. Respond to Customer Inquiries: Respond promptly to phone calls and in-person queries from patients seeking medication information, clarification about dosing instructions, or addressing concerns related to medication side effects or allergies.

7. Collaborate with Healthcare Providers: Foster communication with healthcare providers (e.g., primary care physicians, specialists) to stay informed about patient medication plans' evolving needs or updates on drug regimens' efficacy or safety concerns. Inquire about prescription changes, new prescriptions, or updates on patients' medical status that could affect medication management approaches.

8. Maintain Cleanliness and Sanitation Practices: Ensure strict adherence to pharmacy cleanliness protocols by regularly cleaning workstations, equipment surfaces, and frequently touched areas to promote hygiene standards critical for preventing transmission of infectious diseases among patients and staff members.

9. Manage Insurance Claims Processing: Efficiently process prescription claims by double-checking patient insurance coverage details before dispensing medications, verifying benefits eligibility statuses, and submitting claims promptly to insurers to facilitate timely payment reimbursements for both patients and pharmacy operations.

10. Continuously Educate Yourself: Continuously expand knowledge through ongoing pharmacy training and professional development opportunities to stay current with emerging pharmacological research, medication safety guidelines, and regulatory updates impacting daily pharmacy practices, improving patient outcomes and overall pharmacy performance.

instruction: Design a template table for keeping track of all subscriptions.
output:
Subscription Tracker Template

| Subscription Name                  | Service Provider            | Plan Name                   | Price per Month ($)   | Billing Frequency   | Payment Method      | Expiration Date     | Renewal Date         | Notes/Comments                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |

This subscription tracker template provides a comprehensive view of all active subscriptions, enabling efficient management and budget monitoring. Each subscription entry includes essential information about the service provider, plan name, monthly cost, billing frequency (e.g., monthly, quarterly, yearly), payment method (credit card, ACH, etc.), upcoming expiration date, and scheduled renewal date. Additionally, the Notes/Comments section offers space for relevant observations regarding account specifics, such as any promotional pricing or auto-renewal preferences.

To populate this subscription tracker template, users can input the relevant data for each subscription in their possession across various industries and services, such as streaming platforms (e.g., Netflix, Disney+), cloud storage solutions (e.g., Dropbox, Google Drive), software applications (e.g., Adobe Creative Cloud, Microsoft Office 365), subscription-based e-learning platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Learning, Coursera), virtual private network (VPN) services (e.g., NordVPN, ExpressVPN), email marketing tools (e.g., Mailchimp, Constant Contact), project management suites (e.g., Asana, Trello), and more.

By regularly reviewing this subscription tracker template, businesses or individuals can assess subscription expenditures, evaluate subscription value versus usage, identify potential subscription redundancies or overlaps, monitor renewal dates for strategic cost-saving opportunities, and maintain comprehensive records for financial reporting purposes.

instruction: Plan an agenda for the daily standup meetings. Assign a time duration to each topic on the agenda.
output:
Daily Standup Meeting Agenda

Duration for each topic: 5-10 minutes per section

1. Roll Call (2 minutes)

The facilitator initiates the meeting by welcoming everyone and conducting a quick roll call. Each team member briefly introduces themselves, shares their current role, and acknowledges their presence at the meeting. This practice helps establish accountability and ensures all team members are aware of each other's attendance.

2. Brief Status Update (5-7 minutes)

Team members share concise, action-oriented updates regarding their assigned tasks or ongoing projects. Encourage each participant to communicate in short, specific sentences that highlight progress made since the last daily standup meeting. This approach enables the team to stay informed about individual work progress, identify blockers, and adjust plans accordingly.

3. Blocker Identification and Resolution (3-5 minutes)

The facilitator prompts discussion around potential roadblocks that could impede progress towards achieving daily, weekly, or longer-term goals. Encourage team members to articulate any impediments encountered and possible solutions to overcome them collaboratively. This exchange empowers team members to address obstacles proactively and resolve them before they escalate into more significant problems.

4. Reviewing Next Steps (2-3 minutes)

In this segment, team members describe upcoming tasks that require immediate attention, upcoming milestones, or anticipated dependencies for successful completion of pending activities. This section emphasizes accountability by clarifying accountability for upcoming commitments and setting expectations for subsequent daily standups.

5. Open Floor (1-2 minutes)

The facilitator invites any additional feedback, questions, or concerns relevant to the team's collective goals, such as communication gaps or coordination issues, to foster transparency and promote constructive dialogue. This section encourages team members to express their thoughts freely and seek clarification where necessary.

6. Wrap-Up (1 minute)

The facilitator concludes the meeting by summarizing key takeaways, reiterating any action items arising from the discussion, and confirming the next day's standup time and location. This brief concluding remark emphasizes follow-through commitments and prepares attendees for the subsequent iteration of the daily standup routine.

instruction:
Answer the following question.

How do you say "good evening" in French.
output: En français, vous diriez "bonsoir" pour dire "bonsoir" ou "bien soir" en répondant à une salutation formelle ou courtoise à l'heure du soir. Il s'agit d'une locution courante et facilement compréhensible dans la langue française, utilisée pour accueillir quelqu'un ou exprimer un souhait de bienvenue lorsque l'heure commence à avancer vers l'après-midi ou l'événement social ou professionnel commence à commencer après la période traditionnelle de la journée.

instruction:
What sound does this make?

好
output:
Without additional context or information about the specific object, action, or environment being referred to, it is difficult to determine the exact sound produced by the phrase "好" (pinyin: hǎo) in Mandarin Chinese.

in general, the character "好" (hǎo) in Mandarin Chinese represents an approximation of the English word "good" or "well." Depending on its usage within a sentence or conversation, it may be pronounced as either "hǎo" (pronounced as "hah-oh") or "huái" (pronounced as "hwah-ee"), depending on the dialect of Mandarin Chinese being spoken.

in some common situations where the character "好" (hǎo) appears, it can produce various sounds that convey different meanings:

1. Expressing agreement or approval: when used at the end of a statement to indicate positive agreement or approval, "好" (hǎo) typically produces a neutral, affirmative tone and sounds like "hǎo" (pronounced as "hah-oh"). For example, a person might say, "我喝了这杯茶真的很好！" ("wǒ hēle zhè bēi chá zhěn de hěn hǎo!" meaning "This cup of tea tastes really good!").

2. Indicating satisfaction or contentment: when used as an interjection to express satisfaction or contentment with a particular outcome or circumstance, "好" (hǎo) also sounds like "hǎo" (pronounced as "hah-oh"). For instance, a person might exclaim, "我最后考到了高级考试的提供者，真的很好！" ("wǒ zùi hòu kào dào le gāojí kǎoshì de tínggōu chéng, zhēn de hěn hǎo!" meaning "I finally passed the advanced exam qualification provider—that's fantastic!").

in some cases, depending on regional variations in Mandarin Chinese pronunciation, speakers may instead use the alternative homophonic character "巧" (huái) to express satisfaction or appreciation, which would result in a slightly distinct sound of "hwái" (pronounced as "hwah-ee"). For example, someone might express delight by saying, "这家巧得了高级课程的授课资料，真巧！" ("zhe jiā huái dé le gāojí kègōng zhìliào, zhēn huái!" meaning "This institution has acquired top-tier course materials—excellent!").

instruction: Give a grammar tip on how to end a German verb.
output:
In German grammar, verbs generally end differently depending on their conjugation class, which is determined by the verb's stem vowel and the verb's tense and person (singular or plural). Here is a general tip for ending German verbs in the present tense (also known as "Gegenwartszustand") based on their conjugation classes:

1. Regular (weak) verbs:

Regular verbs in German are characterized by having a stem vowel that undergoes no change in inflectional endings. In the present tense, regular verbs follow these endings for both singular and plural subject forms:

- Singular: add "-e" to the verb stem (e.g., "schreiben" becomes "schreibe")
- Plural: add "-en" to the verb stem (e.g., "schreiben" becomes "schreiben")

For example, consider the following sentences using the regular verb "trinken" ("to drink"):

- Ich trinke jedes Abend eine Glühwein-Schäale. (I drink every evening a mug of mulled wine.)
- Sie trinken gerne Kaffee mit der Morgenzeitung. (They often drink coffee with breakfast.)

instruction:
This is a test for the reading ability of French. Read the given story carefully, and then answer the question in the end.

Lucie est à la maison avec sa petite-fille, Lin.
Lucie: Oh, non! Nous n'avons pas de pain!
Lin: Ah! Tu vas au supermarché?
Lucie: Oui, je veux une baguette pour mon sandwich.
Do Lin and Lucie have a lot of bread?
output:
No, based solely from the given information presented in the French sentence "Lucie est à la maison avec sa petite-fille Lin. Lucie : Oh, non ! Nous n'avons pas de pain!", it does not indicate whether Lucie and her granddaughter Lin have an ample supply of bread.

The provided dialogue exchange between Lucie and her granddaughter Lin suggests that Lucie has realized they do not possess any bread at home, as she expresses her surprise and exclamation ("Oh, non! Nous n'avons pas de pain!") in response to recognizing this bread shortage while conversing with Lin. In response, Lin proposes a solution by suggesting that Lucie visit a supermarket ("Ah! Tu vas au supermarché?") to acquire a freshly baked baguette specifically for Lucie's intended purpose of preparing a sandwich ("Lucie : Oui, je veux une baguette pour mon sandwich").

Therefore, based on this limited contextual information provided in the French sentence and subsequent dialogue exchange, Lucie and her granddaughter Lin do not have an abundance of bread readily available at their current location or immediate vicinity to accommodate Lucie's sandwich-making need, necessitating a trip to a nearby supermarket to obtain a necessary loaf of bread in the form of a baguette.

instruction: Come up with healthy and easy dinner ideas for weeknights.
output:
1. Grilled Chicken and Vegetable Skewers: Thread marinated chicken breast and colorful veggies like bell peppers, zucchini, and onions onto skewers, and grill until cooked through. Serve with a side of quinoa or brown rice pilaf.

2. Baked Salmon with Roasted Sweet Potatoes and Broccoli: Season salmon fillets with lemon juice, garlic, and herbs like dill or parsley, then bake alongside sweet potato wedges and broccoli florets tossed with olive oil, salt, and pepper until tender and caramelized.

3. One-Pot Lentil and Vegetable Soup: Cook lentils, chopped carrots, celery, onion, garlic, and your choice of seasoning blend (such as cumin, coriander, paprika) in vegetable broth until hearty and flavorful. Serve with crusty whole-grain bread for dipping.

4. Turkey Meatball Stuffed Bell Peppers: Mix lean ground turkey with breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, minced garlic, and Italian seasoning to form meatballs. Stuff them inside halved bell peppers (any color) and bake in the oven with marinara sauce until the peppers are softened and the meatballs browned.

5. Chickpea Curry with Cauliflower Rice: Simmer canned chickpeas with coconut milk, diced tomatoes, ginger, curry powder, turmeric, and a squeeze of lime juice until fragrant and creamy. Serve over nutrient-rich "rice" made by pulsing raw cauliflower florets in a food processor until rice-like consistency, then sautéing with garlic and spices.

6. Grilled Shrimp Salad with Mango Avocado Dressing: Toss cooked shrimp over a bed of mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, sliced cucumber, radish, and sliced mango chunks. Whisk together ripe avocado, lime juice, honey or agave nectar, chopped cilantro, and Greek yogurt for a creamy citrus dressing that complements the seafood and tropical flavors.

7. Zucchini Noodle Stir-Fry with Tofu and Broccoli: Spiralize zucchini into noodles using a vegetable peeler or spiralizer tool. Stir-fry cubed tofu with sliced broccoli florets, minced garlic, sesame oil, soy sauce or tamari, and a pinch of red pepper flakes until browned and tender-crisp. Toss in the zucchini noodles at the end to warm through. Top with sesame seeds or chopped scallions for extra crunch.

instruction:
Provide a cooking hack for improving the flavor of the given food.

popcorn
output:
To enhance the flavor of popcorn and elevate its taste to the next level, consider incorporating the following cooking hack:

1. Season the Popcorn Kernels Before Popping: Instead of simply adding seasonings to your popped popcorn, try infusing the kernels themselves with flavor before popping. To do so, melt a tablespoon of butter or oil (such as olive oil, coconut oil, or avocado oil) in a large pot with 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon of your preferred seasoning blend. Heat the mixture over medium heat until fragrant, stirring occasionally to prevent burning. Add a small handful of popcorn kernels to the pot and cover tightly with a lid. Shake the pot gently over the heat until popping slows significantly. Once popped, remove from heat and transfer the seasoned kernels to a large bowl.

2. Pop Your Popcorn in Batches: To ensure even seasoning distribution throughout your batch of popcorn, pop your kernels in smaller portions. This prevents overcrowding, which can result in unevenly popped kernels and uneven flavor distribution. Using a paper or silicone bag, divide your seasoned kernels into 2-3 cup portions, then pop each portion separately in a covered pot or air-popper until no more kernels pop for about 2-3 minutes.

3. Toss the Popped Popcorn with Seasoned Butter or Oil Mixture: Once all your popcorn kernels have popped, transfer them to a large mixing bowl. In a separate microwave-safe bowl, melt 2-3 tablespoons of butter or oil (depending on the amount of popped popcorn you made) in the microwave for about 30 seconds, stirring occasionally until fully melted. Add another 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon of your preferred seasoning blend to the butter or oil mixture and stir well. Drizzle this seasoned butter or oil over your popped popcorn and toss gently but thoroughly using your hands or a large spoon until each kernel is evenly coated.

4. Customize Your Seasoning Blend: Experiment with various herb, spice, and salt combinations for your seasoned butter or oil mixture to personalize your popcorn flavor profile. For example, try smoky paprika and garlic powder for savory notes, cinnamon sugar and nutmeg for sweetness, or a blend of dried herbs like thyme, rosemary, and oregano for an earthy taste. Feel free to adjust the quantities of seasonings based on personal preference and taste as you go along.

5. Optional Enhancements: To further elevate your seasoned popcorn's flavor profile, consider adding a sprinkle of grated Parmesan cheese or nutritional yeast flakes for cheesy umami undertones; a pinch of cayenne pepper or red pepper flakes for heat; or a drizzle of honey or maple syrup for natural sweetness.

By seasoning both your popcorn kernels before popping and tossing them generously with a customized butter or oil mixture infused with aromatic spices, you can create an irresistible, well-rounded snack that boasts enhanced flavor complexity compared to plain buttered or plain salted popcorn varieties.

instruction: Make a list of snacks and foods to serve as party snacks on a game day!
output:
1. Nachos with cheese sauce, ground beef or vegetarian options like black beans, diced tomatoes, jalapeños, avocado, and sour cream for topping.

2. Baked potato wedges seasoned with salt, garlic powder, and paprika, served with sour cream, chives, and bacon bits (optional).

3. Mini sliders or slider buns filled with your favorite burger toppings like lettuce, tomato slices, pickles, cheese, and special sauce like BBQ, honey mustard or thousand island dressing.

4. Classic chicken wings tossed in your favorite hot sauce or buffalo seasoning, served with blue cheese or ranch dressing for dipping.

5. Crispy sweet potato fries seasoned with cinnamon sugar, sea salt, and smoked paprika for a sweet and savory twist on regular fries.

6. Cheese sticks or bite-sized cubes of aged cheddar, Gouda or Brie cheese paired with crackers or sliced baguette for a quick and easy appetizer.

7. Homemade spinach and artichoke dip made with cream cheese, sour cream, garlic, and Parmesan cheese served with tortilla chips or crudité vegetables like carrot sticks and cherry tomatoes.

8. Deviled eggs with creamy yolks mixed with mayonnaise, mustard, and spices like smoked paprika or cayenne pepper for a protein-packed snack.

9. Bacon-wrapped dates stuffed with blue cheese or goat cheese crumbles for a sweet and salty combination.

10. Crispy fried pickles speckled with a tangy buttermilk coating and served alongside ranch dressing for dipping.

11. Homemade popcorn sprinkled with savory seasonings such as garlic powder, nutritional yeast, or truffle oil for a healthier yet satisfying snack option.

12. Mini quiches filled with bacon, cheddar cheese, and spinach for a hearty bite packed with protein and veggies.

13. Meatball subs featuring juicy beef or turkey meatballs simmered in marinara sauce on crusty bread rolls with melted mozzarella cheese and optional toppings like roasted red peppers or sautéed onions.

14. Grilled skewers of marinated chicken breast chunks or colorful vegetables like zucchini, bell peppers, and pineapple cubes brushed with teriyaki sauce before serving on skewers.

15. Classic party mix featuring a variety of nuts (such as almonds, cashews, and pretzels), dried fruit (like raisins and cranberries), and seasoned pretzel twists or popcorn for crunchy texture contrast.

instruction:
Describe how to prepare the given food in your own words. Note down the ingredients you will need and the steps you will take to prepare them.

Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
output:
To make delightfully chewy chocolate chip cookies, gather the following ingredients:

- 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
- 3/4 cup granulated sugar
- 3/4 cup light brown sugar, packed
- 2 large eggs
- 2 tsp vanilla extract
- 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips

To prepare these chewy chocolate chip cookies, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt until well combined. Set aside.

3. Using an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, cream together the room temperature butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy, approximately 2-3 minutes.

4. Add in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Then stir in the vanilla extract until thoroughly combined.

5. Gradually incorporate the dry ingredients into the butter mixture in three additions, mixing until just incorporated after each addition. Be careful not to overmix the dough, as this can result in tough cookies.

6. Fold in the semisweet chocolate chips evenly throughout the cookie dough with a spatula.

7. Using a cookie scoop or spoon, portion the dough into balls roughly two tablespoons in size and place them onto the prepared baking sheet with at least two inches of space between each ball. Flatten the dough balls slightly with your fingertips to encourage even baking and a chewier texture.

8. Bake for approximately 10-12 minutes or until the edges turn golden brown while the centers remain set and soft to the touch (these cookies will continue to firm up as they cool). Avoid overbaking, as this can result in crispier edges and drier centers instead of maintaining their signature chewy texture.

9. Remove from the oven and allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for at least five minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely before serving or storing in an airtight container at room temperature for up to five days. Enjoy your deliciously chewy chocolate chip cookies!

instruction: Suggest a recipe for a vegan dessert.
output:
Vegan Chocolate Avocado Mousse

Ingredients:

- 2 ripe avocados
- 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
- 1/2 cup maple syrup or agave nectar
- 1/2 cup full-fat coconut milk (chilled in the fridge overnight)
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- Pinch of sea salt

Instructions:

1. Cut the avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a blender or food processor.

2. Add the cocoa powder, maple syrup or agave nectar, coconut milk, vanilla extract, and sea salt to the blender or food processor.

3. Blend the mixture on high speed until smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides as needed. The avocado may take a few minutes to fully incorporate with the other ingredients.

4. Transfer the chocolate avocado mousse to individual serving bowls or a single larger bowl. Cover with plastic wrap directly on the surface of the mousse to prevent browning.

5. Chill the mousse in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or until firm enough to hold its shape when spooned out.

6. Once chilled, serve the vegan chocolate avocado mousse as desired, garnished with fresh berries, chopped nuts, or shaved chocolate if desired. Enjoy your rich and decadent vegan dessert!

instruction: Design a medium-level sudoku puzzle.
output:
Here is a medium-level Sudoku puzzle:

|  7  |  2  |  6  |  4  |  5  |  1  |
|----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|
|  4  |  3  |  9  |  1  |  8  |  2  |
|  5  |  1  |  3  |  7  |  2  |  9  |

In a Sudoku puzzle, each row, column, and 3x3 subgrid (highlighted with bold lines in this example) must contain the digits from 1 to 9 exactly once. To solve this specific puzzle, consider the following steps:

1. Note that there are only two numbers left to place in the top row (7 and 1). Since both these values are already present in their respective columns (2 and 4), they can only occupy the two remaining empty cells in the top row:

   |  7  |  2  |  6  |  4  |  5  |  1  |
   |----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|
   |  4  |  3  |  9  |  1  |  8  |  2  |

2. To fill in the bottom-right corner (9), examine the corresponding column (3) and eliminate possible placements based on previously placed numbers. Since both values 1 and 2 already appear in this column, the only available options for the blank cell are 3, 5, or 8:

   |  7  |  2  |  6  |  4  |  5  |  1  |
   |----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|
   |  4  |  3  |  9  |  1  |  8  |  2  |
   
3. Next, consider the bottom-left corner (3) and eliminate values based on its column (5) and row (5). The only valid placement for this number is thus either in the empty cell in the second row or third column:

   |  7  |  2  |  6  |  4  | **8** |  1  |
   |----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|
   |  4  | **3** |   9  |   1  |   8  |   2  |
   
4. Now, examine the bottom row's middle column (6) and eliminate values based on previously filled cells. Since both numbers, 1 and 2, already appear in this column, only three choices remain for the blank cell:

   |  7  |  2  | **6** |   4    |   8    |   1    |
   |----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|
   |   4    |   3    |    9    |    1    |   8    |   2    |

5. Finally, focus on the unfilled cell in the second row's rightmost column (9). Examine its row (2) and column (8) to determine its only viable placement:

   | **7**  |  2  | **6**    |   4    |    8    |    1    |
   |----|-----|-----|-----|-----|-----|
   |   4    | **3**     |     9     |     1     |     8     |     2     |

To solve this Sudoku puzzle, we can follow the standard Sudoku solving strategy of systematically filling in the missing numbers based on the available clues provided in the given grid. Here's how to complete this particular Sudoku puzzle:

1. Start by identifying the empty cells (represented by blank spaces in the grid) and numbering them using the notation (row, column). In this case, there are 16 empty cells across the 9x9 grid.

2. Utilize the given clues to eliminate potential numbers for each empty cell. For instance, let's tackle row 1:

- For cell (1, 2), since the value 5 already appears in this row (in position (1, 3)), we can rule out 5 as a candidate for this empty slot.

- Similarly, in cell (1, 5), we know that both 3 and 8 are present within its respective columns (columns 3 and 8, respectively). Thus, those numbers cannot be filled into this open position.

- In contrast, cell (1, 6) only has two elimination options: neither 3 nor 6 can be inserted since these values already exist in the same column (column 6).

- Moving on to cell (1, 8), we can exclude values 1 and 4 as they appear in the same row (row 1).

- Lastly, for cell (1, 9), we can cross out numbers 2 and 9 because both of these digits occur within the same column (column 9).

3. Repeat this elimination process for every empty cell throughout the puzzle, using similar reasoning based on available information from the given grid. Here are the remaining solutions:

- For row 2:
  - Cell (2, 1) cannot hold either 5 or 8 due to their occurrences in column 1.
  - In contrast, cell (2, 4) can only accommodate values 1 or 9 since both options remain untouched within column 4.
  - Moving to cell (2, 7), we can exclude possibilities 2 and 6 because these integers appear in row 2 and column 7, respectively.

- Row 3 presents no further constraints since no overlapping numbers exist among its empty cells and known values.

- For column 2:
  - Cell (3, 2) cannot contain either number 6 or 8 since these digits already occupy row 3 and column 2, respectively.

- Similarly, cell (4, 2) cannot hold either value 3 or 4 due to their appearances in both row 4 and column 2.

- In contrast, cell (5, 2) allows only choices 1 or 7 since neither number has been assigned within column two yet.

- Moving on to column 3:
  - Within this vertical segment, cell (4, 3) cannot contain number 1 due to its presence in row 4 and column 3.

- Cell (6, 3) can take either of two remaining possibilities: neither number 5 nor value 6 can be inserted since both appear within row six and column three.

- Lastly, for column 4:
   - Empty slot (2, 4) cannot accommodate number 8 since this digit resides within the same row and column combination.

   - Likewise, cell (7, 4) cannot accept either value 2 or number 4 because both occur within row seven and column four.

   - Consequently, open position (8, 4) permits insertion of either number one or nine as these integers remain unassigned across this specific column.

- Moving to column five:
   - Cell (3, 5) excludes options two and seven due to their placement within row three and column five, respectively.

   - In contrast, empty slot (4, 5) can only accept either integer one or eight as neither digit appears in either row four or column five yet.

   - Furthermore, for cell (5, 5), neither number three nor five can appear because these values already occupy both row five and column five concurrently.

- Column six presents no additional constraints since none of its blank cells share identical row or column positions with any given value in the completed Sudoku grid.

- Regarding column seven:
   - Empty cell (2, 7) cannot hold value six due to its presence within the same row and column combination as previously observed.

   - Likewise, open position (6, 7) cannot accommodate number four since this integer appears within the same row and column pairing.

   - Therefore, cell (7, 7) accepts either integer one or eight as these numbers haven't been assigned within row seven or column seven thus far.

- Lastly, for column eight:
   - Cell (1, 8) already precludes entries two and nine via their coexistence with these values in both row one and column eight.

   - Consequently, open slot (4, 8) permits insertion of either digit three or six since neither choice has been utilized within row four or column eight so far.

   - Finally, for cell (8, 8), neither number one nor eight can be inserted due to their existing placement within the same row and column combination as observed previously.

With these steps complete, all unknowns in the given Sudoku puzzle now possess unique numerical assignments satisfying its constraint rules:

|1|5|3|    |    |    |   8|   6|4|
|   |    |   |    |   3|    |   9|    |   |
|8|3|4|6|7|    |   9|    |    |
|2|9|1|    |    |   8|3|7|6|
|   |    |6|    |   9|8|   1|    |   |
|   |2|    |   5|7|6|    |    |    |
|5|4|    |   9|7|6|   3|    |    |
